intro: Actinea ursina, commonly known as the bear's buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The plant features delicate, yellow flowers with five petals and a central cluster of stamens, typical of the genus Actinea. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three leaflets, and are often covered in fine hairs. Actinea ursina thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
